page.title: 18Grange Estate, Kettering.
page.content: Grange Estate was built in the mid- 50's to cater for the enlarging population at that time. The estate is wholly of council houses but recently some have been purchased and are now attractive private dwellings. One area has large 4/5 bedroomed houses. There are 3 Christian churches: R.C., Anglican, Methodist. All roads have a lady's name (Jean Road, Ruth Gardens). It is a fact that this is now one of the poorer areas of Kettering with much unemployment, 1 parent families, split homes and children in care. This has been recognised by the Borough Council who have just produced Â£Four Wards Study Kettering 1985.' The various indices of deprivation are examined as they exist here and in Avondale, St. Mary's and St.Andrew's Wards. Recommendations are made for future action to improve the situation.
